chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to start?
Hola. Yes ready to start!
okay, from the starting point, i see a twig leading to a small island with a tiger, another island southeast with a butterfly and a bigger one southwest of the tiger with a parrot
where do i go first?
GO to the small island with a tiger first.
Entendido, ahora estoy en la isla del tigre.
es bastante pequeño aquí. Desde aquí, ¿adónde sigue?
Next the island with the parrot.
Muy bien, ahora estoy con el loro.
¿que sigue?
cross the rocks and go towards the island with the frog
Aquí estoy, junto a la rana en la isla.
¿Y ahora qué?
Cross the crocodile towards where the elephant is
cruce el cocodrilo
ahora estoy de nuevo con el elefante
cross the rocks and towards the island with the giraffe.
Ok, llegué a la isla con la jirafa.
¿Qué sigue?
Cross the twig onto the next island what do you see?
¡Veo una serpiente! Entonces, ¿adónde vamos ahora?
Cross the serpent and the chest should be there
Genial, encontré el tesoro! *terminado* eres el mejor en esto, ¿dónde más podemos aventurarnos?

chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to go?
Hola estoy bien. Yes
good to hear! now, let's start from where the white dog sits. take a casual stroll towards the left, heading below a wooden bench
you're going towards a florist stand. stay with me
Ok I'm at the florist stand
¡espera! No vayas al puesto, hagamos un giro de 180 grados a la izquierda, crucemos el sendero de regreso a ese lindo perro blanco.
Estoy con el perro blanco.
alrighty then! we're now going south, below this bench and towards another white dog chilling next to a checked picnic mat
let's go!
im heading towards the other white dog
buen trabajo! Ahora vas a evitar esa estera de picnic.
¡aviso! Hay un cuenco de bayas que debes tocar mientras te diriges al oeste.
ok para donde le doy ahora
oh my bad! i meant, you'll pass along a bowl of berries while heading west
sorry for the confusion
now, there should be a wooden branch ahead
let's cross that river again but this time to the north!
Si lo veo
fantastic! shall we cross the river?
si
happiness! once you have crossed the river, avoid that green bush on the right and continue until you reach the flower stand
ok estoy con las flores
maravilloso! now, here's a twist: you're gonna go left, under this stand, heading towards that big bridge out there
can you see the cyclists going by?
si los veo
love it! now continue along the bridge
After the bridge, you'll spot two elderly people on a bench reading newspapers. can't miss 'em!

chat.msg: hey there, estas listo?
Hi Yes are lets get started
¡impresionante! Estoy en la tienda en el norte.
¿Adónde vamos ahora, amigo?
si ves a un perro al south
sí, veo al perro junto al fuego
¿a dónde vamos después?
go towards the dog and pass underneath it. T
then make you wa towards the campfire and go above it.
Oye, pasé al perro y veo un hongo rojo a mi derecha.
¿Estoy en el camino correcto?
justo al lado del fuego ahora
¿a dónde ir a continuación?
Yes go towards the red mushroom cross underneath it and make you way towards a blue car
vale, estoy junto al coche azul ahora
¿Y ahora qué?
make a left avoiding the tree and make your way towards a telescope
Ahora estoy parado junto al telescopio azul.
¿Qué hago a continuación?
continue walking underneath the telescope towards some rocks.
estoy frente a las rocas
¿Debería ir alrededor de ellas o, aún?
The final destination should be in those rocks cross them
¡bingo! Estoy en la casa de madera rodeada de rocas.
*finalizado*

chat.msg: hola, you ready?
hola si estoy listo
awesome! start off by walking south-west under the first palm tree you see
now, take a right and cross the second palm tree. once you're past that, hang a sharp left and keep heading south
a sharp left towards the dog
¡entiendo! ahora, muévete a la izquierda del cachorro marrón.
luego, gire ligeramente a la izquierda y gire a la derecha; siga hacia el sur.
el sur pasando el cachorro?
Yes, exactly! continue south past the dog
ase las rockas?
yep! go between the big rock on your left and the small one on your right
you'll hit the water next. let's take a dip!
do i go into the water?
I'm near the water now
¡así es! Camina hacia el agua hasta que te encuentres frente a un gran cangrejo rojo.
perfecto! Haz un giro a la derecha en el agua y camina a lo largo de la gran roca, continuando hacia el oeste.
ok y ahora que sigue?
after you pass a medium rock, you'll see a shark in the water
make a sharp right after seeing it
ok and now
ahora regresa a la tierra y pasa entre la roca mediana a tu izquierda y esa fría bola azul, amarilla y blanca a tu derecha.
luego, dirígete hacia el norte

general_survey.answer: I lived with my parents who only spoke Spanish while I as at home.
general_survey.question: Have you ever lived in a home environment or country where your second language was spoken? If so, please explain briefly:
On a day-to-day basis, how likely are you to have a conversation using both your first and second languages?
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At work
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At home
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with friends
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with family
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Using social media
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
Do you enjoy mixing languages in conversation?

general_survey.answer: I can understand why some people do it. I try and not do it just because I feel it makes me seem smarter if I don't mix the languages.
general_survey.question: What do you think when others mix languages in conversation? Please explain:
Any final comments about your language background?
